tweets.html:
For the rest of my life, I am going to have the Gergich's "eggs, bacon and toast" song stuck in my head. #ParksAndRec

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) April 19, 2013

Damn Elena is out of control! Just killin‚Äô folks & shit. Who does she think she is? Heisenberg? The Governor?#WalkingBreakingDiaries#TVD

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) April 19, 2013

Could we have just one episode of MAD MEN where Scott Bakula plays Peggy?

— Silas Lesnick (@silaslesnick) April 20, 2013

Show that exploits tragedies and national buzz inopportunely renewed in moment of tragedy, national buzz. #glee

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 19, 2013

Fucking #Glee.

— Lion-Hearted Girl (@letloverule42) April 19, 2013

Breaking news about Glee getting picked up for 2 additional seasons has the smell of completely fabricated CNN reporting.

— Andrew Miller (@MillerLoLife) April 19, 2013

Glee just got a two-season renewal, which will free them to do longer, more complicated narrative arcs of up to 7 minutes.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 19, 2013

FOX renewed #Glee for two more seasons?! This day just got immeasurably worse.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) April 19, 2013

Hannibal gets pulled, but somehow Splash remains.

— Julie Hammerleüî® (@JulieHammerle) April 19, 2013

NBC pulls episode of "Hannibal" until America cool with killing again.

— Mike Scully (@scullymike) April 19, 2013

When do we all start to blame the Russian rap industry.

— Garance Franke-Ruta (@thegarance) April 19, 2013

Walter Cronkite is spinning in his grave today. Or as CNN would put it, "Walter Cronkite is alive and currently taking a spin class."

— Adam Proteau (@Proteautype) April 19, 2013

The CNN homepage is just a picture of Wolf Blitzer shrugging.

— Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) April 19, 2013

Fred Armisen is doing an amazing job as this uncle in this press conference right now.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

CNN's next new series: "The Raging Uncle." Book it, Zucker.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

While the Raging Uncle made for great TV, the shouted questions just further killed an already dead profession called "journalism."

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

Sigh. Just realized we're probably less than 24 hours from someone auto-tuning the Uncle Ruslan press conference. Because it's what we do.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) April 19, 2013

"Could be related, could not be related." - CNN reporter, summing up last 48 hours of everything we've seen on television.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

As if the desolate downtown wasn't enough, now towns are losing power in the area. Worst ep of #Revolution ever.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

CNN's Deborah Feyerick is giving a master class on reporter idiocy.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

I would like to change the channel from CNN but the asinine level is so high I can't risk what I might miss.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

"He had a lot of friends. He had 77 friends on his website page" - CNN is your 60yr old parents

— kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) April 19, 2013

CNN going over this guy's Twitter feed was better than anything "SNL" will ever do with it. Just‚Ä¶wow‚Ä¶.Wow.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

"This suspect both smoked weed AND used hashtags on Twitter. Coincidence?????" --CNN, essentially

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

CNN is ten seconds away from discovering that animated .GIFS exist. I'm on the edge of my seat.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

‚ÄúGentlemen, I promise you: April 19 is WITHOUT A DOUBT the BEST POSSIBLE DAY to unveil Amazon‚Äôs slate of expensive new pilots.‚Äù - Jeff Bezos

— Jeff Greenstein (@blue439) April 19, 2013

CNN is talking about the upcoming "controlled explosion." Yeah, that's gonna be me blowing up my TV, Wolf.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) April 19, 2013

News anchors are to pronouncing "Dzhokar" as awards show announcers are to "Les Miserables" #somanypronunciations

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) April 19, 2013

tweets.author_name: in states unborn and accents yet unknown, someone
tweets.html:
I won't really be comfortable with all this until South Park oversimplifies it

— in states unborn and accents yet unknown, someone (@oldjetsam) April 19, 2013

Does anyone know a good site where I can get a rapid flow of misinformation and unconfirmed reports coming in too fast to process?

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) April 19, 2013

Hey CNN, where is the girl who used to babysit for one of the teachers at the school the bomber went to? Why haven't we heard from her mom?

— Peter Waldron (@pjwaldron) April 19, 2013

All day the news has been showing the most grueling, tense episode of "House Hunters" ever.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

'Well, fuck.' - Producers of VH1's 'Best Week Ever' in today's meeting.

— Chris Smith (@ChrisSmithCBW) April 19, 2013

Finally, the REAL victims: RT @TheWrap: How Will the Boston Bombings Manhunt Affect Box Office This Weekend http://t.co/YKee2SonHM

— James Moran (@jamesmoran) April 19, 2013

Al Sharpton covering the breaking news in Boston is the funniest Anchorman 2 teaser yet

— Matt Oswalt (@MattOswaltVA) April 19, 2013

Jeff Zucker said in a memo that "CNN shined this week," proving once and for all that he doesn't know shit from shinola.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) April 19, 2013

Wolf Blitzer on CNN: "I don't know what's going on."

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) April 19, 2013

"This is a dramatic moment going on right now. We don't know what's going on right now." Wolf Blitzer, drunk and/or insane. #CNN

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

"We want to be cautious in what we are reporting." Why start now, MSNBC?

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 19, 2013

NBC Nightly News interrupted by NBC special report interrupted by NBC 4 tornado warning. All in 3 minutes. I have NEVER seen this before.

— üéôAmy Morris ‚òÄÔ∏è (@amorris991) April 19, 2013

"Can you confirm about the boat, blood, a body, and...whatever?" Well said, Mr. Matthews. Eloquent.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 19, 2013

They've either found the suspect alone on a boat, or Wolf Blitzer is just riffing on seeing Life of Pi in 3D a couple months ago. #manhunt

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) April 19, 2013

OMG - watching NBC news live. Brian Williams threw it to a reporter who didn't know he was on, admitting, "we don't know shit."

— Jen Maiser (@JenMaiser) April 19, 2013

Finally, someone says it MT @JenMaiser: OMG NBC news live. BrianWilliams threw it to reporter didn't know he was on: "we don't know shit"

— Bruce Arthur (@bruce_arthur) April 19, 2013

The "good" part about this happening early is that Scott Pelley can sooth me through crisis.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 19, 2013

To summarize this is/is not the suspect and he's alive/dead. Also, there's a boat. #news

— Judd Legum (@JuddLegum) April 19, 2013

Good thing this will be over today, wouldn't want it distracting people from watching Smash tomorrow.

— Cheryl Heuton (@CherylHeuton) April 19, 2013

As a former local news guy, I assure you despite everything going on there are thousands of people calling to complain Jeopardy isn't on

— Alan Cavanna (@CopaCavanna) April 19, 2013

The scariest part about this whole thing? I'm pretty sure this was the exact plot of Speed 2: Cruise Control

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) April 20, 2013

BREAKING: CNN reporting that the boat is "dark-skinned."

— Imani Gandy Canes (@AngryBlackLady) April 20, 2013

What if it's Dexter on that boat?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 20, 2013

Turn off the sound on CNN and imagine Anderson Cooper and John King having a silver fox-off.

— Tony Bleach (@acbleach) April 20, 2013

Don't worry, Nancy Grace is still covering the Jodi Arias trial with an inhuman vigor.

— Gretchen Gavett (@GretchenMarg) April 20, 2013

Twitter is now just everyone playing for time in between quoting Pete Williams.

— HuffPost Media (@HuffPostMedia) April 20, 2013

Coming this fall... CSI: Reddit.

— Adam Casey (@adamccasey) April 20, 2013

Boston Police URGE people on Twitter to DO A TWITTERSEARCH TO MAKE SURE YOUR BOAT JOKE HASN'T BEEN SAID 500 TIMES ALREADY

— NunesMagician.com (@NunesMagician) April 20, 2013

Let's never do this again, guys.

— Sean Highkin (@highkin) April 20, 2013

Decades from now, I'll tell my grandkids where I was when Dzhokar Tsarnaev was caught: "In front of a computer." Response: "What's that?"

— Andrew Katz (@katz) April 20, 2013

The long national nightmare of CNN coverage is over.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 20, 2013

"White Hat Captured," says BPD, which means they've apparently also captured Olivia Pope. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

You stopped? It's called multitasking. RT @thecinemadoctor: Internet, you may now resume your Friday night porn browsing.

— Mark Stewart (@markboynz) April 20, 2013

I gotta believe the Huffington Post has built up quite a sideboob backlog during all of this.

— Bryan Donaldson (@TheNardvark) April 20, 2013

Diane Sawyer to reporter: ‚ÄòWhen you say he‚Äôs in custody, what does that mean?‚Äù ‚ÄúIt means he‚Äôs in custody, Diane‚Äù

— Claire Sutherland (@brolga2) April 20, 2013

Memo to Dick Wolf: Law & Order:Boston or Lah & Adah:Bahstin

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) April 20, 2013

Poor Shepard Smith: He has to politely chastise and walk back the previous half-hour of "speculation" by O'Reilly and Geraldo. @FoxNews

— kentucker (@kentucker) April 20, 2013

Remember when you watched 24 and you were like, ‚Äúhow can all that shit happen in one day?‚Äù

— Justin Robert Young (@JustinRYoung) April 20, 2013

If today was an season of 24, that would have been episode 23, ending only to have Jack find out Kim has been taken by the uncle.

— Matthew Carney (@matthewcarney) April 20, 2013

Funny because it's kinda true. RT @BorowitzReport: BREAKING: NATION CHEERS END OF CNN'S COVERAGE

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) April 20, 2013

‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù. It‚Äôs a news show people watch. RT @WhitlockJason: Never heard of Scott Pelley until today. He made a fan.

— Mark Pesavento (@markpesavento) April 20, 2013

Do this- BREAKING: The angry Chechen uncle has been given NBC 12:30 slot after Jimmy Fallon

— Justin Stangel (@Justin_Stangel) April 20, 2013

Been away from Twitter a while. Did I miss anything?

— Andy Bobrow (@abobrow) April 20, 2013

Can't believe we spent this whole week talking about Obama snubbing the Thatcher funeral

— slackbot (@pareene) April 20, 2013

shoutout to people tweeting about non-Boston stuff this week. you‚Äôre showing MASH reruns during the Superbowl. but I respect it

— lawblob (@lawblob) April 20, 2013

Whoa! Epic closed captioning FAIL! ‚Äú@joelmchale: Oh my RT @peterogburn: http://t.co/F3sbpmq9WO‚Äù

— zooey deschanel (@ZooeyDeschanel) April 20, 2013

SIRI IS THAT A FALSE FLAG RT @ZooeyDeschanel Whoa! Epic closed captioning FAIL! ‚Äú@joelmchale: Oh my RT @peterogburn: http://t.co/ABsO8Ir9Ys‚Äù

— slackbot (@pareene) April 20, 2013

A brief summary of what we‚Äôve learned from the convergence of broadcast media this week: purple monkey dishwasher.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) April 20, 2013

The crisis is not completely over as long as Piers Morgan is still on the air.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) April 20, 2013

Brian Williams, don't try and do a Boston accent. Those poor people suffered enough.

— Andrew M. Seaman (@andrewmseaman) April 20, 2013

"He'll sing like he's on The Voice!" says minor character from Tom Clancy novel who somehow ended up on MSNBC.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 20, 2013

.@MichaelChiklis If Vic Mackey had handled this, Russia would have surrendered.

— Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) April 20, 2013

The CW is airing an "Oh Sit!" rerun, so I guess we've already returned to normal, guys.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

BREAKING: The angry Chechen uncle has been given NBC 12:30 slot after Jimmy Fallon

— Justin Stangel (@Justin_Stangel) April 20, 2013

To honor Boston, I will now only root for the Patriots to lose 15 games

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) April 20, 2013

Nothing but class this guy @realDonaldTrump: Is the Boston killer eligible for Obama Care to bring him back to health?

— Patrick Baldwin (@PCBaldwin) April 20, 2013

Hey NBC News. Great job. Can you have @bwilliams eviscerate @realDonaldTrump on air again to cap off the night?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 20, 2013

In response to anything Donald Trump ever says, I quote from Annie Hall: "What an asshole."

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 20, 2013

Hey @nbc. Immediately fire @realDonaldTrump for his continual classless comments and replace him with Rock Center. Or a test pattern.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 20, 2013

Hey CNN and NBC, fire Donald Trump and Jeff Zucker so they can start a network together.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 20, 2013

So does this mean SNL is bringing in Rachel Dratch and Jimmy Fallon this week?

— Sara Clarke (@sara_clarke) April 20, 2013

So, how do they top this for May sweeps?

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) April 20, 2013

This isn't so much a press conference as it is an Oscar speech with the hum of "USA USA" pulsing underneath. Tell us about the suspect!

— Taylor Cole Miller (@taycole) April 20, 2013

Sudeikis as the cop.

— Matthew Gilbert (@MatthewGilbert) April 20, 2013

NBC's Chuck Todd again points out President Obama was watching feeds of local Boston TV stations. Yes, folks. Broadcasting matters.

— Dennis Wharton (@AirWharton) April 20, 2013

Obama mentions Twitter as a sometimes bad source for info. In other words, HE FOLLOWS ME.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

"Tweets"? President Obama's talking about US!

— Daniel Fienberg (@d_fienberg) April 20, 2013

"This f$cking week, you guys. Right?" --More prosaic Obama

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

shorter Obama: <3 Boston, Texas we are with you; racists + blogs FML

— Alison Forns (@alisonforns) April 20, 2013

You go ahead and celebrate, Boston. But for Ben Affleck, months of hard work on a script are just beginning.

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) April 20, 2013

My drag down refresh thumb is raw after Twitter today. So intense. This bombing thing took its toll on all of us.

— Criminelle Law (@CriminelleLaw) April 20, 2013

Administration will not Miranda suspect due to public safety exemption and because suspect is reportedly "such a Samantha"

— slackbot (@pareene) April 20, 2013

That was literally the worst joke I've ever tweeted btw goodnight everyone

— slackbot (@pareene) April 20, 2013

Boston PD? Pfffft. My wife watches shows where they solve bigger cases in less than an hour.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) April 20, 2013

Jose Canseco has a podcast

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) April 20, 2013

We got that terrorist dude and all, so, hey, ABC, can we please air those 'Happy Endings' eps...

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) April 20, 2013

just when we need the funny, ABC preempts #HappyEndings and airs #lastmanstanding Really? Seriously? Cc @happywrites

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) April 20, 2013

Why did they ever cancel that Fantasy Island reboot with Malcolm McDowell

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) April 20, 2013

Friday night cool person observation about TV: Tamara/Jake are the Clark/Martha of "awkward."

— Joe Reid (@joereid) April 20, 2013

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
Oh my god, VH1 has a show about a small mixed show choir in Wisconsin and it is the worst thing ever and I love it. #OffPitch

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) April 20, 2013

If my life was watching Allison Janney do comedy all day, I would be perfectly content. #Mom #pilotseason

— nathan reinhart (@nathanrrr) April 20, 2013

This episode of #Community is shot in almost all close-ups. It's freaking me out.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) April 20, 2013

Also, comedy dies in close-ups.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) April 20, 2013

My DVR didn't record #TheOffice this week. Either it was a repeat or an act of mercy.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) April 20, 2013

Huffpo wins Pulitzer for Breakup Stories of Celebrities Nobody's Ever Heard Of.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) April 20, 2013

Number of minutes I've been watching Hemlock Grove: 18. Number of times I've said "What is even happening?": 4.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 19, 2013

98% of my feed is following the manhunt. The other 2% is randomly quoting #HemlockGrove.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

The people who wrote #HemlockGrove haven't written for television before. It's unclear if they've *watched* television before.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 20, 2013

That was mean. But this is a mess.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 20, 2013

NOTHING HAPPENS ON THIS FUCKING SHOW. It's like watching CNN, only sometimes there's nudity. #HemlockGrove

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 20, 2013

Watching Hemlock Grove. Hoo boy. *tugs collar* Yeah. *clears throat* This isn't...um...yeah.

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) April 20, 2013

From everything I've read so far #HemlockGrove looks like it has serious drunken live tweeting potential

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) April 20, 2013

I'm starting to believe all the dialogue for #HemlockGrove is pulled from the @Horse_ebooks feed.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 20, 2013

I basically don't understand what Dougray Scott's character is doing at any point ever. #HemlockGrove

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 20, 2013

@TVandDinners Did you get to the episode where nothing happens yet? Wait, I should narrow that down.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 20, 2013

Back to #HemlockGrove! "Someone has replaced this rake with a child of mine." They made Lili Taylor say that.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 20, 2013

@AndyDaglas Maybe Netflix took their "computer generated programming" a step too far.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 20, 2013

@zhandlen Netflix Original Series: Now 65% Turing Test-Proof!

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) April 20, 2013
